availability.p: This is an open access work licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license.

interpGrp.interp: Changes in spelling or orthography. This includes any alterations to how words are written without affecting their meaning, such as standardizing spelling or correcting errors. Also includes adding or removing an alif as a marker of the accusative or at the end of a plural verb. Changes to the diacritics for a final ي or ى can be ignored. If the change affects the meaning or grammatical function of the word (such as the form of a verb), then it is more significant than an orthographic change and should not be in this category.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single minor word or part of a word. A minor word means a conjunction, pronoun, demonstrative pronoun (e.g. ذلك), pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, interrogative particle (such as 'ما') or other particle (such as 'قد'). This includes the expansion or contraction of a word and changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice, including changes to person or number and transformations between participle and verb. If the root word is the same but the number changes, then it falls in this category. It can still be in this category if the change affects the meaning substantially, so long as it is only affecting the part of speech described here or it does not change the root of the word. If there are changes to multiple words between readings (even if they are minor), then it should not be in this category but it is under 'Multiple_Word_Changes'. If there are multiple minor changes to a single word, then it can still be a Single_Minor_Word_Change.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single word that is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, or particle (such as 'قد'). It is only a major word change if the root of the word is different. If a word is changed to a different form of the same root, then it is a Single_Minor_Word_Change. If the two readings are identical except for a difference in a single major word, then it is in this category (even if the readings otherwise contain multiple words).

Changes across more than one word. Words can be major or minor. Even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in this category. If more than one word is added or omitted, then it is in this category.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه

relation.desc: Several words are added.
More than one word is changed because by transposing اليهود it also affects the ل preposition.

This is because multiple words are being added where there was previously no text. The added text consists of several words including قال, الرب, للذين, اتوا, اليه, and من اليهود. This matches examples like "OMIT → قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه" and "OMIT → فاما انا فلست من هذا العالم" where multiple words are added where there was previously no text.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود

This is a case where multiple words are added to the text that were not present before. The addition includes several words (قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود) which matches examples in the Multiple_Word_Changes category such as "OMIT → قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه" and "OMIT → فاما انا فلست من هذا العالم" where multiple words are added to the text.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

The only difference between these readings is the omission of the final alif in اتوا which becomes اتو. This is a purely orthographic change that doesn't affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. The examples provided show that changes involving the addition or omission of an alif at the end of a plural verb are classified as orthographic changes (e.g. "تكونوا احرار → تكونو احرار").
c.f. قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
Several words are added.

This is because multiple words (فكلمهم ايضا يسوع) are being omitted. According to the definition, if more than one word is added or omitted, then it falls in this category. This is similar to examples like "تسمعون اقوالى → OMIT" and "فقال لهم → OMIT" where multiple words are omitted.
c.f. فكلمهم ايضا يسوع ➞ OMIT
A single major word is added.
Two words are added.

The change involves adding the major word صوته while retaining وقال. Since this affects more than one word (by adding a new word), it falls under Multiple_Word_Changes, similar to examples like "فقال → اجاب يسوع وقال" where multiple words are added.
c.f. وقال ➞ صوته وقال
The pronoun هو is added which is a minor word.

The preposition الي is omitted, which counts as a single minor word change since prepositions are considered minor words according to the category definitions. The change in spelling of في/فى is purely orthographic and can be ignored when determining the category.
c.f. يمشي في الظلمه الي ➞ يمشي فى الظلمه
The preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
The preposition ل is added to الدهر.

This variation involves changes to two words: الابد is changed to الدهر (a major word change) and معه is changed to له (a minor word change involving a preposition with suffix). When there are changes to more than one word, even if one is minor and one is major, it falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون له

This variation involves changes to multiple words: الابد is changed to الدهر (a major word change), and معه is changed to له (a change in preposition with suffix). Even though the second change is minor, because there are changes to multiple words, this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definitions provided.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The word الابد is changed to الدهر. This is a change of a single major word (noun) to another noun with a different root. The rest of the phrase remains identical. This is similar to other examples of Single_Major_Word_Change where one major word is substituted for another, like بيت الكنز → بيت القربان.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

This is because there are two distinct changes: (1) الابد is changed to للدهر, which is a change in a major word, and (2) معه is changed to له, which is a change in a preposition with pronominal suffix. Since there are changes to more than one word (even though one is minor), this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change from تكون to يكون is a modification to the form of a single verb (from t-prefix to y-prefix), which falls under the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves "changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice, including changes to person or number." The root of the verb remains the same (ك-و-ن).
c.f. الدهر بل تكون له ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

This variation involves two distinct changes: (1) the verb form changes from يكون to تكون, and (2) the preposition with pronominal suffix changes from له to معه. Even though both changes could individually be considered minor word changes, when multiple words are changed - even if they are minor changes - it falls under the Multiple_Word_Changes category according to the definition provided.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

This is because there are two distinct changes: (1) الدهر is changed to للدهر by adding the preposition ل, and (2) the verb form يكون is changed to تكون. Even though both changes could individually be considered minor changes (adding a preposition and changing verb form), when multiple words are changed - even if the changes are minor - it falls into the Multiple_Word_Changes category according to the definition provided.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

This variation involves changes to two words: (1) الدهر is changed to للدهر by adding the preposition ل, and (2) معه is changed to له, which involves changing one preposition with a pronominal suffix to a different preposition with a pronominal suffix. Since there are changes to multiple words (even though they are both minor changes), this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The word نور is added, which is a major word (noun) that changes the meaning substantially. Since this involves the addition of just one major word, while the rest of the reading remains identical, it falls under Single_Major_Word_Change according to the definition and similar examples provided (like "OMIT → باثامكم" or "OMIT → الشيطان" where a single major word is added).
c.f. الحياه ➞ نور الحياه

The word الي is a preposition, which falls under the category of minor words according to the definition. The change involves adding a single minor word where there was none before (OMIT). This is similar to examples like "اتوا اليه → اتوا اليه من" where a single preposition is added.
c.f. OMIT ➞ الي
The pronoun انت is added and an alif is added to تشهد.
A ب preposition is add to حق.
The orthographic change is made to يسوع making it ايسوع and the ف conjunction is changed to a و.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع.
The verb اجاب is added and the phrase فقال لهم is moved to the end. The conjunction ف is changed to a و.

This is because multiple changes occur: the word اجاب is omitted, the words are reordered, and there is an orthographic change to يسوع/ايسوع. Even though one change is just orthographic (يسوع/ايسوع), when combined with the other changes affecting multiple words, it must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition.
c.f. اجاب يسوع فقال لهم ➞ فقال لهم ايسوع

The change involves only the spelling of يسوع/ايسوع, which is a common orthographic variation in Arabic manuscripts. This exact variation appears multiple times in the example list under Orthography (e.g. "اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم → اجاب يسوع فقال لهم"). The addition or removal of the initial alif in يسوع/ايسوع does not affect the meaning or pronunciation of the word.
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب يسوع وقال لهم

The conjunction و is changed to ف, which is a change to a single minor word (conjunction). According to the category definitions, changing a conjunction is considered a Single_Minor_Word_Change, and there are similar examples in the provided list such as "فقال → وقال [The conjunction ف is changed to و]" and "فلم يمسكه → ولم يمسكه [The conjunction ف is changed to و]".
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

The change involves multiple words: the addition of the major word اجاب and a reordering of the other words. Even though the words لهم and ايسوع remain the same, the fact that multiple words are affected by the change means it must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition and examples provided.
c.f. فقال لهم ايسوع ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

Two changes occur in this variation: (1) the spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع, and (2) the conjunction و is changed to ف. Even though both changes are relatively minor (an orthographic change and a change in conjunction), because they affect multiple words, this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definitions provided.
c.f. اجاب يسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم
The conjunction و is added.
The preposition هي is added.

app.rdg: من اين انا والى اين انطلق فاما انتم
من اين انا والي اين اذهب واما انتم
اين اتيت ولا الى اين انطلق
اين اتيت ولا الي اين اذهب

relation.desc: Multiple words are changed.

Two minor words are changed: the conjunction و is omitted and the particle انما is omitted. Even though both are minor words, because multiple words are affected, this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition.
c.f. وانتم انما ➞ انتم
The major word تقظون is omitted.

This is because two words (ايما and تقضون) are being omitted. According to the definition, if more than one word is added or omitted, then it falls into the Multiple_Word_Changes category. This is similar to examples like "تسمعون اقوالى → OMIT" where two words are omitted.
c.f. ايما تقضون ➞ OMIT
The pronoun انتم is added.

The addition of تقضوا represents the addition of a single major word (a verb). This is similar to examples like "تكونوا → OMIT" and "تقدروا → OMIT" in the Single_Major_Word_Change category, where a single major verb is added or removed.
c.f. OMIT ➞ تقضوا
The conjunction و is added.

The change involves both the removal of اما and the addition of و. Even though both are minor words (اما is a particle and و is a conjunction), because the change affects multiple words, it must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition provided.
c.f. اما انا ➞ وانا

The particle اما is omitted while keeping the conjunction و and the pronoun انا. Since this involves the omission of a single particle (which is considered a minor word), this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change according to the definition and examples provided.
c.f. واما انا ➞ وانا
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two changes occur. The conjunction ف is added at the start and the orthographic change occurs by addings an alif of nasb to احد.
Diacritics are added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start.

Two changes occur in this variation: (1) the conjunction ف is added at the start, and (2) an alif of nasb is added to احد. While the second change is orthographic and the first is a minor word change, when taken together they constitute changes to multiple parts of the reading, similar to the example "ليس ادين احد → فليس ادين احدًا" provided in the Multiple_Word_Changes category.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احدا

The conjunction ف is added at the start of the phrase. Since this is just the addition of a single minor word (a conjunction), it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change according to the definition. This matches similar examples provided such as "ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا" and "اما انتم فتفعلون → واما انتم فتفعلون" where a single conjunction is added.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احد

The conjunction ف is added at the start of the phrase. Since this is a change to a single minor word (adding a conjunction), it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change. This matches examples like "ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا" and "اما انتم فتفعلون → واما انتم فتفعلون" where a conjunction is added at the start.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احدا

This falls under Multiple_Word_Changes because there are two distinct changes: (1) the addition of the conjunction ف at the beginning, and (2) the removal of the alif of nasb from احدا. While the second change is orthographic in nature, when combined with the addition of a conjunction, it constitutes changes to multiple words. This matches examples like "ليس ادين احد → فليس ادين احدًا" which is explicitly categorized as Multiple_Word_Changes in the examples provided.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves removing the alif of nasb (accusative marker) from احدا to become احد. This is a purely orthographic change that does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This type of change is explicitly mentioned in the category description for Orthography and appears in multiple examples (e.g. "ليس ادين احدا → ليس ادين احد").
c.f. فليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The only difference between these readings is the removal of the alif of nasb (accusative marker) from احدًا. According to the category definitions, changes involving the alif of nasb are considered orthographic changes. This is supported by similar examples in the Orthography category such as "ليس ادين احدا → ليس ادين احد" and "تكونوا احرارا → تكونوا احرار".
c.f. فليس ادين احدًا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves both the addition of the pronoun هو and the modification of لاني to لان (removing the pronominal suffix ي). Since this affects two separate words (even though they are both minor word changes), it must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition provided.
c.f. لاني ➞ هو لان
Changes occur to two words.
The form of لست is changed to ليست.
The form of ليست is changed to ليس.

The change involves modifying the form of the negative particle from لست to ليس. This is a change to a single minor word (a particle) that affects the person of the negation but maintains the same basic meaning and function. This is similar to other examples in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category where verb forms or particles are modified, such as "ليست واحدى → ليس وحدي".
c.f. لست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي

The change involves modifying the form of ليست to ليس, which is a change in the form of a single word. Since this is a change to the form of the same word (not changing its root), and it only affects one word, it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change. This is similar to the example "ليست واحدى → ليس وحدي" provided in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category.
c.f. ليست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي
The pronoun انا is added.
A pronominal suffix is added.
A و conjunction is omitted and pronominal suffix is added to a single word.

The change involves the removal of the conjunction و and a change in how the pronominal suffix is written. Since this affects a conjunction, which is classified as a minor word, this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change. While there are two changes to the word (removing و and changing the suffix), they are both minor changes to a single word, which still qualifies as Single_Minor_Word_Change according to the definition.
c.f. ولكني ➞ لكنى
Multiple words are added.
Multiple words are omitted.
Two words are added.

The word حق is a major word (noun) being omitted. This fits the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change since it involves the omission of exactly one major word. This is similar to other examples in the Single_Major_Word_Change category where a single major word is omitted, such as "وقال → OMIT" and "كثيرين → OMIT".
c.f. حق ➞ OMIT

The change involves adding two words (حق هي) where there was previously only one word (حق). This matches an example provided: "OMIT → حق هي [Two words are added.]" Even though هي is a minor word (pronoun), when multiple words are involved in the change, it falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition.
c.f. حق ➞ حق هي
The pronoun انا is omitted.
The pronoun (with conjunction) وانا is omitted.

The change involves adding the conjunction و at the beginning of انا. Since this is the addition of a single conjunction, which is classified as a minor word, and it affects only one word, this falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category. This is similar to other examples provided where a conjunction is added, such as "اما انتم فتفعلون → واما انتم فتفعلون" where و is added at the beginning.
c.f. انا ➞ وانا
The major word اشهد is omitted.
The preposition علي is omitted.

The word نفسى is a major word (a noun with a pronominal suffix) that is being omitted. This fits the pattern of other examples in the Single_Major_Word_Change category where a single major word is omitted, such as "تكونوا → OMIT" and "كثيرين → OMIT". Since only one major word is affected, and no other changes are involved, this clearly belongs in the Single_Major_Word_Change category.
c.f. نفسى ➞ OMIT

The preposition على is changed to لي. Since this is a change of a single preposition, which is classified as a minor word, and no other words are affected, this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change according to the definitions provided.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي ذلك

This involves changes to multiple words: the preposition على is changed to ل (with pronominal suffix ي), and the demonstrative pronoun ذلك is changed to the pronoun وهو. Even though these are both minor words, because more than one word is changed, it falls into the Multiple_Word_Changes category.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي وهو

The change involves two minor words: the demonstrative pronoun ذلك is changed to the pronoun وهو (which consists of the conjunction و and the pronoun هو). Even though both are minor words, because multiple words are affected, this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition.
c.f. لي ذلك ➞ لي وهو

This is an orthographic variant because it only involves a change in the spelling of the name يسوع by adding an initial alif, without affecting the meaning or pronunciation. This is similar to the examples provided where يسوع/ايسوع variations are consistently categorized as orthographic changes.
c.f. يسوع ➞ ايسوع
Two words are omitted.
Two words are omitted.

The change involves replacing the conjunction ف with و, which is a change to a single minor word (conjunction). This matches similar examples provided such as "فقال → وقال" and "فلم يمسكه → ولم يمسكه" where a conjunction ف is changed to و.
c.f. فقال لهم ➞ وقال لهم
The preposition ب is added to هذا.

The word كان is omitted. Since كان is a major word (it's not a conjunction, pronoun, demonstrative pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, interrogative particle, or other particle), this falls under Single_Major_Word_Change. This is similar to examples like "تكونوا → OMIT" or "وقال → OMIT" where a single major word is omitted.
c.f. كان يكلمهم ➞ كلمهم
The noun الكنز is changed to القربان.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two words are changed.
The article ال is added.
Two words are changed.

The change involves removing the pronominal suffix ه from ساعته, making it ساعه. Since this is a modification to a single word that only affects a pronominal suffix, it falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category according to the definition provided. The examples show that changes to pronominal suffixes are considered minor word changes.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان ساعه لم

The change involves adding the definite article ال and removing the pronominal suffix ه. Since this only affects a single word and involves changes to minor elements (article and pronominal suffix), it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change. This is similar to the example "لان ساعه لم → لان الساعه لم" where the article ال is added.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان الساعه لم

Two words are changed: لان is changed to اذ, and ساعه is changed to كانت. When multiple words are changed, even if the changes are minor, it falls into the Multiple_Word_Changes category according to the definition.
c.f. لان ساعه لم ➞ اذ كانت لم
Two words are changed.
The word بلغت is changed to اتت.
The verb اتت is changed to اقتربت.
c.f. تكون اقتربت ➞ تكن اتت

This variation involves changes to two words: تكن is changed to تكون (a change in verb form) and بلغت is changed to اقتربت (a change to a different root word). While the first change would be a minor word change on its own, and the second would be a major word change on its own, because there are changes to multiple words, this must be categorized as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definitions provided.
c.f. تكن بلغت ➞ تكون اقتربت

The change involves modifying the form of تكون to تكن, which is a change in the form of a single verb. According to the category definitions, changes to verb form fall under Single_Minor_Word_Change, and since only one word is affected while اتت remains unchanged, this is the appropriate category.
c.f. تكون اتت ➞ تكن اتت

Two changes occur: the form of تكون is changed to تكن (a minor change) and the verb اقتربت is changed to اتت (a major change since it involves a different root). Since there are changes to multiple words, even though one is minor and one is major, this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

relation.desc: Multiple wrds are added.
The final alif in اتوا is omitted.
Multiple wrds are added.
Two words are omitted.

This is because there are changes to multiple words: اذهب is changed to انطلق (different root), وفي is changed to ولا (different word), and there is an orthographic change to وتطلبوني. When multiple words are changed, even if some changes are minor, it falls into the Multiple_Word_Changes category.
c.f. اذهب وتطلبوني وفي ➞ انطلق وتطلبونى ولا

The conjunction و is omitted, which is a minor word change according to the definition. The definition specifically includes conjunctions as minor words, and since only one minor word is affected, this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change rather than Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. وبخطاياكم ➞ خطاياكم

This is because there are changes to more than one word: خطاياكم is replaced with two different words تجدونى وباثمكم. Even though one could argue that باثمكم is semantically similar to خطاياكم, the fact that multiple words are involved automatically puts this in the Multiple_Word_Changes category according to the definition provided.
c.f. خطاياكم ➞ تجدونى وباثمكم

The justification is that this involves changing the form of a single verb from تموتون to تموتوا. Changes to verb forms (including changes in person, number, or mood) are classified as Single_Minor_Word_Changes according to the definition, as long as the root remains the same. This is similar to examples like "تقدروا → تقدرون" and "تكونوا → تكونون" in the provided examples.
c.f. تموتون وحيث ➞ تموتوا وحيث
The pronoun (with conjunction) فانتم is added.

The verb انطلق is changed to اذهب, which represents a change in the root of the verb (different lexeme). Since this affects only one major word (the verb) and involves a change in the root, it qualifies as a Single_Major_Word_Change. The pronoun انا remains unchanged.
c.f. انطلق انا ➞ اذهب انا

The change involves both a change in the verb from اذهب to انطلق (which changes the root) and the addition of فانتم. Since there are changes to more than one word (even though فانتم is a minor word), this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. اذهب انا ➞ انطلق انا فانتم
The form of تاتون is changed to تاتوا.

This variation involves changes to multiple words: ليس is changed to لا (both negative particles but different words), and تاتون is changed to تجون (different root verbs). Even though one change involves minor words (the negative particles), when combined with the change to the main verb, this constitutes changes to multiple words, placing it in the Multiple_Word_Changes category.
c.f. ليس تقدرون تاتون ➞ لا تقدرون تجون

The change involves modifying the form of the verb تقدرو to تقدرون. This is a change in the form of a single verb without changing its root, which falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category according to the definition. This is similar to other examples provided like "تقدروا → تقدرون" and "تكونوا احرار → تكونون احرار" where the form of the verb changes.
c.f. ليس تقدرو تاتوا ➞ ليس تقدرون تاتوا

This variation involves changes to multiple words: ليس is changed to لا (both negative particles but different words), and تاتوا is changed to تجون (different root verbs). Even though one change involves minor words (the negative particles), when combined with the change to the main verb, this constitutes changes to multiple words, placing it in the Multiple_Word_Changes category.
c.f. ليس تقدرون تاتوا ➞ لا تقدرون تجون
The form of the verb قالوا is changed to قال

The interrogative particle ما is a minor word according to the category definitions, which explicitly lists interrogative particles (such as 'ما') as minor words. This is a single addition of a minor word, similar to examples like "ان → OMIT" and "OMIT → هو" in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category.
c.f. OMIT ➞ ما
The minor word ان is added.
The form of تاتوا is changed to تاتون.
The pronoun انتم is omitted.
The pronoun انتم is changed to ان and the form of the verb تاتون is changed to تاتوا. Both are minor changes but taken together, they are a changes to multiple words.

This is because there are two changes occurring: the pronoun انتم is changed to ان and the form of the verb تاتون is changed to تاتون. Even though both are minor changes (changing a pronoun and modifying a verb form), because they affect multiple words, this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition. This matches the example given: "انتم تاتون → ان تاتوا [The pronoun انتم is changed to ان and the form of the verb تاتون is changed to تاتوا. Both are minor changes but taken together, they are a changes to multiple words.]"
c.f. انتم تاتون ➞ ان تاتون

The verb تاتون is changed to تحون, which involves a change in the root of the verb (from اتى to حوى). Since this affects only one word and involves a change in the root, it qualifies as a Single_Major_Word_Change. The pronoun انتم remains unchanged.
c.f. انتم تاتون ➞ انتم تحون

This involves two changes: the omission of the minor word ان and a change in the form of the verb from تاتوا to تاتون. While both changes are minor in nature (affecting a particle and verb form), because they affect multiple words, this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definitions provided.
c.f. ان تاتوا ➞ تاتون

This variation involves changes to multiple words: the minor word ان is changed to the pronoun انتم, and the verb تاتوا is changed to تحون with a different root. Even though انتم is a minor word, when combined with the change to the verb, this constitutes changes to multiple words, placing it in the Multiple_Word_Changes category.
c.f. ان تاتوا ➞ انتم تحون
The conjunction وis omitted.
The conjunction و is changed to ف.

The change involves the removal of the conjunction ف (fa-) at the beginning of the word. Since this is a change to a single minor word (specifically, the removal of a conjunction), and conjunctions are explicitly listed as minor words in the category definition, this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change. This is similar to other examples provided where conjunctions are changed or removed, such as "فقال → وقال" and "فلم يمسكه → ولم يمسكه".
c.f. فقال ➞ قال

The word ايضا is a major word (an adverb meaning "also") that is being omitted. Since this involves the omission of a single major word while انتم remains unchanged, it falls under Single_Major_Word_Change. This is similar to other examples in the Single_Major_Word_Change category where a single major word is omitted, such as "كثيرين → OMIT" or "تكونوا → OMIT".
c.f. ايضا انتم ➞ انتم
The minor word اما is omitted.

The change involves modifying the independent pronoun انتم to the suffix form انكم. Since this is a change to a pronoun, which is classified as a minor word, and it only affects one word, this falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category. The examples show that changes to pronouns are considered minor word changes.
c.f. انا انتم ➞ انا انكم

The change involves replacing انا with اما, which is a minor word change since اما is a particle. Even though this affects the meaning, it still falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change because it only involves changing one minor word (a particle).
c.f. انا انتم ➞ اما انتم

The pronoun انا is omitted. Since this is a change to a single minor word (a pronoun), and pronouns are explicitly listed as minor words in the category definition, this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change. This is similar to other examples where a single pronoun is added or removed, such as "الجسد → الجسد انتم" or "OMIT → هو".
c.f. انا انتم ➞ انتم
Multiple words are omitted.

The change involves adding the conjunction ف at the beginning of the phrase. Since this is a change to a single minor word (adding a conjunction), and conjunctions are explicitly listed as minor words in the category definition, this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. من هذا العالم ➞ فمن هذا العالم

This is because multiple words (فمن هذا العالم) are omitted. According to the definition, if more than one word is added or omitted, then it falls in this category. Similar examples include "تسمعون اقوالى → OMIT" and "ان شهاده رجلين فانها → OMIT" where multiple words are omitted.
c.f. فمن هذا العالم ➞ OMIT

فاما انا فلست من هذا العالم

relation.desc: Multiple words are omitted.
Multiple words are added.

This is because multiple words are being omitted (فاما انا فليس من هذا العالم). This matches examples like "فاما انا لست من هذا العالم → OMIT" in the Multiple_Word_Changes category. When more than one word is omitted, it falls into this category according to the definition.
c.f. فاما انا فليس من هذا العالم ➞ OMIT

This change involves the addition of three words (من هذا العالم). Since more than one word is added, it falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition which states "If more than one word is added or omitted, then it is in this category."
c.f. OMIT ➞ من هذا العالم

The conjunction و is removed, which represents a change to a single minor word (specifically the removal of a conjunction). This is similar to examples like "اما انتم فتفعلون → واما انتم فتفعلون" where a conjunction is added/removed.
c.f. وان ➞ ان

The word ان is a minor word (a particle) and it is being omitted. This matches the example "ان → OMIT" in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category. Since only one minor word is affected, this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change rather than Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. ان ➞ OMIT
Two words are omitted.
The major word باثامكم is added.

The word بخطاياكم is a single major word (noun with preposition and pronominal suffix) that is being omitted. This is similar to examples like "باثامكم → OMIT" where a single major word is omitted. It is not a minor word like a conjunction, pronoun, or particle, and only one word is affected.
c.f. بخطاياكم ➞ OMIT
Multiple words are omitted.

The change involves adding the conjunction و at the start of the phrase. Since this is a change to a single minor word (adding a conjunction), it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change. This is similar to examples like "اما انتم فتفعلون → واما انتم فتفعلون" where a و conjunction is added at the start.
c.f. ان تكلمت ➞ وان تكلمت
